looks like the X dev files are not installed
the missing file (X.h) will be there when you install X development
you can add a link of /usr/include/X11 to /usr/X11/include
sorry, I was wrong about the file location, I was looking at an older machine.  The ubuntu (xorg) location is indeed /usr/include/X11
a link is an alias for a file or a directory
your software is looking for /usr/X11/include/X.h, but your machine has /usr/include/X11/X.h
so if you do this:  sudo ln -s /usr/include/X11 /usr/X11/include, the file will be found by make
add, not change
you leave everything as it is so you don't screw up all the programs that are correctly configured.  :)
but adding a link is safe
right, then try it.  You may simply get a different error, but it is definitely worth a try.
in that case you probably do need to install the X dev files
if that's the case, the software may well be smart enough to find the file in the correct place
right.  install X dev support and try your build again.  Then if it is still failing, and /usr/include/X11/X.h exists, we go back to the link
